Global Enumerators¶

Perhaps the only truly global parameters that we will be using - these define integer aliases for a number of finite lists.

Because of the way that default-labelled enums work, we also take this opportunity to ‘count’ the number of elements in the arrays, using the final entry as a counting marker.

enum ElementID¶

Defines a globally recognised ordering of the elements + provides them with a nice readable name.

Values:

enumerator Hydrogen¶
enumerator Helium¶
enumerator Metals¶
enumerator Iron¶
enumerator Oxygen¶
enumerator Magnesium¶
enumerator Carbon¶
enumerator Silicon¶
enumerator Calcium¶
enumerator Manganese¶
enumerator Chromium¶
enumerator Cobalt¶
enumerator Europium¶
enumerator ElementCount¶

The final entry should always be ElementCount, as the numbering system inherent in enums makes this true only if it is the last entry!

enum SourceProcess¶

Defines a globally recognised set of aliases for sources of gas, used to label GasStream objects.

Values:

enumerator Accreted¶
enumerator Stellar¶
enumerator Remnant¶
enumerator ProcessCount¶

As with ElementID, final entry is used to count the number of elements. This must always be the final entry.
